arxiv.description: Search arXiv preprints for scientific papers. Provides search, fetch abstracts, get PDF links.
arxiv.usage_note: Use for physics, CS, math, and other STEM papers. Returns PDF URLs for caching.

semantic_scholar.description: Semantic Scholar API for academic papers with citations, influence scores, and paper details
semantic_scholar.usage_note: No API key required for basic access (rate limited). Use for cross-disciplinary search and citation analysis.

pubmed.usage_note: Free API. Use for medical, biology, health sciences. Returns PMIDs and abstracts. PDF links via PubMed Central.

crossref.description: Crossref metadata for DOI resolution and citation data
crossref.usage_note: Use for resolving DOIs to full metadata, finding papers by DOI, checking citations
crossref.etiquette: Include email in User-Agent header for polite pool access

crunchbase.usage_note: Requires paid API key. Use for startup funding, acquisitions, people data.

sec_edgar.description: SEC filings and public company data
sec_edgar.usage_note: Free access. Requires User-Agent header. Use for 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K filings.

academic_researcher: Use WebSearch to find papers and identify PDF URLs
For arXiv papers: Extract arXiv ID and construct PDF URL (https://arxiv.org/pdf/XXXX.XXXXX.pdf)
For PMIDs: Use PubMed API to check for free full-text via PMC
For DOIs: Use Crossref API to get metadata, then search for open access PDFs
Pass all PDF URLs to pdf-reader.sh prepare command for caching
Use Read tool on cached PDFs for full-text analysis
pdf_analyzer: Receives already-cached PDF paths from academic-researcher
Focuses on structure extraction and content analysis
Does not handle fetching or caching
synthesis_agent: Receives structured analysis from pdf-analyzer and academic-researcher
Can request additional PDF analysis if needed

optional_api_keys.NCBI_API_KEY: Register at https://ncbiinsights.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/2017/11/02/new-api-keys-for-the-e-utilities/ for higher rate limits (10 req/s vs 3 req/s)

note: Academic MCP servers are ENABLED by default. They use free public APIs and require no setup. Market sources (except SEC EDGAR) require API keys and are disabled by default.
